snippet: Back-to-back visits from the Palestinian and Israeli leaders hinted that China had given some thought to playing a more energetic, if very limited, role as mediator.
abstract: News analysis; China takes modest step into Middle East diplomacy, hosting back-to-back visits from Palestinian Authority leader Mahmoud Abbas and Israel's Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu.

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Patrick Zuo and Sue-Lin Wong contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Back-to-back visits from the Palestinian and Israeli leaders hinted that China had given some thought to playing a more energetic, if very limited, role as mediator.

headline.seo: China Dips a Toe Into Mideast Diplomacy
headline.main: China Dips a Toe Into Middle East Peace
headline.print_headline: China, Beckoned, Dips a Toe Into Mideast Peacemaking
